LABEL: Loan Default
DATASET_DESCRIPTION:
This dataset simulates the likelihood of borrowers defaulting on a loan based on attributes such as Age, 
Income, Credit Score, Loan Amount, Loan Term, Interest Rate, Employment Length, Home Ownership, Marital Status, and Dependents. 
The 'Loan Default' variable serves as the label, indicating whether a borrower is likely (1) or not likely (0) to default on the loan.

FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Age: Age of the borrower in years, ranging from 18 to 70.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Income: Annual income of the borrower in dollars, ranging from $20,000 to $150,000.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Credit Score: Credit score of the borrower, ranging from 300 to 850.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Loan Amount: Loan amount requested by the borrower in dollars, ranging from $1,000 to $50,000.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Loan Term: Loan term in months, ranging from 12 to 60.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Interest Rate: Interest rate of the loan in percentage, ranging from 3.5% to 25%.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Employment Length: Number of years the borrower has been employed, ranging from 0 to 40.
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Home Ownership: Home ownership status, represented as 0 (Rent), 1 (Own), or 2 (Mortgage).
FEATURE_DESCRIPTIONS.Dependents: Number of dependents, ranging from 0 to 5.

LABEL_DESCRIPTION: Indicates the likelihood of loan default, with 0 representing no default and 1 representing default.
